ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Unilateral Conductive Hearing Loss (Left)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient presents with persistent conductive hearing loss in the left ear following bilateral tympanoplasties, with normal bone conduction indicating intact inner ear function.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess the physical status of the ear canals and tympanic membranes given the history of surgery.
Determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
Evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities to assess functional hearing.
Standard assessment for middle ear function, though deferred in this specific case due to previous otosurgery.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient exhibits normal hearing in the right ear with a slight high-frequency conductive component, and a moderate rising to mild conductive hearing loss in the left ear. Bone conduction is normal bilaterally. Speech recognition is excellent. Otoscopy reveals intact tympanic membranes with left-sided retraction. Immittance testing was not performed due to the surgical history.

tests.name: Otoscopy
tests.result_summary: Both tympanic membranes intact; left tympanic membrane slightly retracted.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal thresholds (250-3000 Hz) sloping to slight conductive loss (4000-8000 Hz). Left ear: Moderate rising to mild conductive loss (250-2000 Hz), sloping to moderate at 3000 Hz, rising/sloping in highs. Significant air-bone gaps in the left ear.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 12 dB HL, WRS 96%. Left SRT 35 dB HL, WRS 92%. Results consistent with pure-tone thresholds.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Not performed due to previous otosurgery.

proposed_items: Review of previous audiograms and otosurgery records
Hearing aid evaluation for the left ear
counseling_actions: Discuss the conductive nature of the hearing loss and the healthy status of the inner ear
Explain potential rehabilitation options including hearing aids if medical management is not pursued or successful

escalation.rationale_short: For review of surgical records and determination of medical intervention for the retracted tympanic membrane and persistent conductive loss.

follow_up_plan.objective: Retest hearing to determine the need for amplification or other interventions.
